quiz.subtitle: 7.6: Decomposition Reactions

questions.question: A decomposition reaction is best defined as a chemical change in which:
options: A single reactant breaks down into two or more simpler products.
Two elements combine to form one complex compound.
Oxygen reacts with a hydrocarbon to produce heat.
An element replaces another in a solution.
questions.explanation: Decomposition is the opposite of synthesis; it starts with one substance and ends with multiple, following the form $AB \rightarrow A + B$.

questions.question: Which of the following equations represents a decomposition reaction?
questions.explanation: Hydrogen peroxide (one reactant) breaks down into water and oxygen gas (two products).

questions.question: What is usually required for most decomposition reactions to occur?
options: Energy in the form of heat, light, or electricity
The addition of a second reactant
questions.explanation: Because bonds must be broken to decompose a compound, an input of energy is almost always necessary.

questions.question: The decomposition of a binary compound (like $NaCl$) results in:
questions.explanation: Binary compounds break down into the individual elements that make them up ($2NaCl \rightarrow 2Na + Cl_{2}$).

questions.question: What are the products when Calcium Carbonate ($CaCO_{3}$) undergoes thermal decomposition?
questions.explanation: Metal carbonates decompose into a metal oxide and carbon dioxide gas.

questions.question: The process of using electricity to decompose water into hydrogen and oxygen gas is called:
questions.explanation: Electrolysis uses an electric current to drive the non-spontaneous decomposition of water.

questions.question: When a metal chlorate (like $KClO_{3}$) decomposes, one of the products is always:
questions.explanation: Metal chlorates decompose into a metal chloride and oxygen gas ($2KClO_{3} \rightarrow 2KCl + 3O_{2}$).

questions.question: Which general pattern identifies a decomposition reaction?
questions.explanation: This pattern clearly shows a single source yielding multiple distinct entities.

questions.question: What are the products of the decomposition of Carbonic Acid ($H_{2}CO_{3}$)?
questions.explanation: Carbonic acid is unstable and readily decomposes into water and carbon dioxide, which is why sodas fizz.

questions.question: If you see an equation with only ONE substance on the reactant side, you can be sure it is a:
questions.explanation: By definition, if there is only one reactant, it must be breaking down into simpler parts.
